title: Colorado Late Autumn Trip
important_notes: Weather is unpredictable; pack for both sun and snow.
Microspikes or traction devices are highly recommended for high-elevation trails.
Trail Ridge Road in RMNP will likely be closed. Access the park from the Estes Park side.
Always check for reservations for RMNP, attractions, and popular restaurants.
Sunset is around 6:00 PM; plan activities accordingly.

events.description: Arrive in Boulder, check into your accommodation.
Head to the Pearl Street Mall. It's a vibrant, pedestrian-only street with great restaurants, shops, and street performers.
events.notes: Dinner suggestions: Oak at Fourteenth (upscale), The Kitchen (farm-to-table), or Mountain Sun Pub & Brewery (classic Boulder vibe).

events.description: Drive from Boulder to Estes Park. Grab coffee and pastries in Estes Park.
Enter Rocky Mountain National Park through the Beaver Meadows entrance.
events.notes: Check the official NPS.gov/romo website for the status of the timed entry permit system. You may need to reserve your entry slot in advance.

events.description: Hike the Emerald Lake Trail (3.6-mile round-trip). This trail takes you past Bear Lake, Nymph Lake, and Dream Lake, culminating at Emerald Lake.
events.notes: Expect snow and ice on the trail. Microspikes are essential.

events.description: Have a packed lunch near the trail or head back to Estes Park.
Explore other accessible areas of the park, such as Sprague Lake (easy loop with beautiful views) or Moraine Park to look for elk.
Drive back to Boulder. Dinner suggestion: Avery Brewing Co.

itinerary.theme: Boulder's Nature and Denver's Culture (Happy Halloween!)

events.description: Hike the Chautauqua Trail to the Flatiron Loop Trail (2.7 miles).
events.notes: This moderate hike offers fantastic views of the city and the Flatiron rock formations.

events.description: Have lunch in Boulder.
Drive to Denver and explore. Option 1: Denver Art Museum or Meow Wolf Convergence Station. Option 2: RiNo Art District or Larimer Square.
Have dinner in Denver. Afterward, enjoy Halloween festivities or drive back to Boulder.
Drive to Garden of the Gods in Colorado Springs. Walk the Perkins Central Garden Trail (1.5 miles).
events.notes: A National Natural Landmark with dramatic red rock formations.

events.description: Grab lunch in nearby Manitou Springs or Old Colorado City.
Choose your adventure. Option A: Manitou Incline (strenuous, reservations required). Option B: Red Rock Canyon Open Space (moderate, less crowded).
Drive to Green Mountain Falls, a small, charming town.
Watch the sunset from the town's central lake and gazebo, or from a viewpoint along the road.
Have dinner and stay the night in Green Mountain Falls or nearby Manitou Springs.
Drive to the Paint Mines Interpretive Park. The hiking is easy, but the landscape is unforgettable.
events.notes: A hidden gem with fantastical geological formations of colorful clay and rock spires (hoodoos).

events.description: Find a spot in a town on your way back north.
On your drive back towards Boulder, stop at Castlewood Canyon State Park. The Canyon View Nature Trail is a great option for a final, relaxing hike.
Arrive back in Boulder for your last night. Enjoy a final Colorado dinner.
Enjoy a final breakfast in Boulder. Suggestion: The Buff Restaurant.
Drive to Denver International Airport (DIA) for your flight home.
